page.title: 13Education in the Butley Area
page.content: The average family in the Butley area with two or three children of school age may find that they attend three different schools. Under the age of nine children are transported to Eyke school by bus. The child aged 9 to 13 walks or cycles to Butley Middle School and those over 13 are taken by bus to Farlingaye High School in Woodbridge, a journey of about eight miles. Eyke School has a play school for under fives attended by some infants from Butley. Some children over 16 go to the Suffolk College in Ipswich for Further Education or vocational training. Farlingaye H.S. has a sixth form for students over 16. A few children got to private schools in Woodbridge or Ipswich. Transport to Ipswich and Woodbridge for these children is a problem, the service bus goes at 7.50am. They return at 6.15pm.
